fields.description:
When running euca-bundle-vol on CentOS 6.5 instances, the process will fail because euca-bundle-vol is trying to pass the {{-d}} option to the {{blkid}} command which is not an option in the older version that is installed on CentOS. 

It seems as though {{blkid}} on CentOS is from 2010, whereas Ubuntu is running a newer version from 2011:

CentOS 6.5:
{code}
blkid from util-linux-ng 2.17.2 (libblkid 2.17.0, 22-Mar-2010)
{code}

From Ubuntu:
{code}
blkid from util-linux 2.20.1 (libblkid 2.20.0, 19-Oct-2011)
{code}

There is also a secondary issue in that euca-bundle-vol continues to execute after the {{blkid}} command fails. I didn't investigate if it *should* or not, but it is something that needs to be looked at. 

*Detailed Reproduction Steps:*
# Installed latest version of euca2ools via RPM per [Euca2ools documentation|https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.0.1/index.html#shared/installing_euca2ools_rhel.html]
# Copied credentials, cloud-cert.pem, and euca2ools config file to instance
# Installed parted into the instance
# Ran euca-bundle-vol, but it failed.  Looks like we are passing the wrong arguments to blkid:

{code}
[root@ip-172-16-203-143 ~]# euca-bundle-vol --debug --cert /root/euca2-admin-c7cace6a-cert.pem --privatekey /root/euca2-admin-c7cace6a-pk.pem  --ec2cert /root/cloud-cert.pem --user 289987666267 --destination /bundled-vol --exclude /bundled-vol -r x86_64 --no-inherit --partition mbr

function in /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/bundle/bundlevolume.py thats causing the issue:
{code}
def _get_filesystem_info(device):
    import pdb; pdb.set_trace()
    blkid = subprocess.Popen(['blkid', '-d', '-o', 'export', device],
                             stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
    fsinfo = {}
    for line in blkid.stdout:
        key, _, val = line.strip().partition('=')
        if key == 'LABEL':
            fsinfo['label'] = val
        elif key == 'TYPE':
            fsinfo['type'] = val
        elif key == 'UUID':
            fsinfo['uuid'] = val
    blkid.wait()
    return fsinfo
{code}
